intro: Thelaia elliptica, commonly known as the elliptic thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features spiny leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Thelaia elliptica typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in grassland environments. Its botanical structure includes a basal rosette of leaves and a flowering stem that rises above the foliage.
